definition[0]: used to say that you hope something will happen in the way you want
example[0]: She hung the washing out, then crossed her fingers for a dry day.
example[1]: The exam’s at two. Will you keep your fingers crossed for me?
definition[1]: to hope that something will happen the way you want
example[2]: We’re keeping our fingers crossed that she’s going to be OK.
definition[2]: to secretly put one finger over another finger, because you are telling a lie – done especially by children
example[3]: ‘He’s nice, ’ said Laura, crossing her fingers under the table.
